page.title: 15ECOLOGY
page.content: There are two categories of Ecology in this area:- (1) Maritime (2)that of typical S.W. countryside. Both are greatly influenced by the proximity of the Bristol Channel and exposure to winds straight off the Atlantic. On the coastline, at tide level, are rock pools rich in sea anemones, limpets and other molluscs. On the cliffs flourish gorse, sea thrift, horned poppies and brambles swathed in dodder. Over these areas fly gulls, kittiwakes,guillemots,hawks and kestrels, while a large variety of small birds, butterflies, moths and some snakes live in the Scrubland. Large trees are scarce. In the few sheltered valleys grow Oak,Ash,Beech, Sycamore and a few Conifers. A storage reservoir has a total capacity of 1,145,000 gallons.
